title: Open Source Communities
text:
This interactive database showcases open source communities. Use the filters below to explore communities by region, category, or search for specific communities.





















We welcome new community submissions! To add your community:

Create a GitHub Issue using our template
Fill in your community details
Our team will review and add your community to the database

For more details, see our Contribution Guidelines.

title: Communities
text:
Browse through our comprehensive list of open source communities. Use the filters below to find communities by region or category.











If your community is not listed, you can add it by: 1. Creating a GitHub Issue using our template 2. Submitting a Pull Request with your community details
See our Contribution Guidelines for more information.

title: Communities
text:
If your community is not listed, you can add it by: 1. Creating a GitHub Issue using our template 2. Submitting a Pull Request with your community details
See our Contribution Guidelines for more information.

title: About
text:
The Open Source Communities database aims to connect and highlight vibrant open source ecosystems globally. We believe in fostering collaboration, knowledge sharing, and community building within open source communities.




Create a comprehensive directory of open source communities
Facilitate connections between communities and contributors
Promote open source culture and collaboration
Document the growth and impact of open source globally




This project is maintained by a group of open source enthusiasts. We welcome contributions from anyone interested in supporting open source communities.



We would like to thank all the communities and contributors who have helped build this database. Your participation makes this project possible.



For general inquiries or to get involved: - Email: chaossasia@gmail.com - GitHub: github.com/chaoss/chaoss-asia

title: Contributing
text:
Thank you for your interest in contributing to our database of open source communities! This document provides guidelines for adding new communities and making other contributions.





Go to the Issues tab
Click “New Issue”
Select the “Community Submission” template
Fill in the following information:

Community Name
Description (2-3 sentences about the community)
Website URL
Region (e.g., Europe, Americas, Africa, Asia)
Category (e.g., Community, Conference, Association)






Fork the repository
Add your community to data/communities.csv following the format:
name,description,website,region,category,country,city_state,member_count,status,type
Create a pull request with a clear description of your changes






Name: Official name of the community
Description: Brief description (2-3 sentences)
Website: Full URL including https://
Region: One of the supported regions in the dataset
Category: One of: Community, Conference, Association, General




If you’d like to contribute code:

Fork the repository
Create a new branch for your feature
Make your changes
Submit a pull request





Use consistent formatting in the CSV file
Keep descriptions concise but informative
Use proper capitalization for community names
Ensure all URLs are valid and accessible




All submissions will be reviewed by the maintainers. We may: - Request additional information - Suggest edits to the submission - Ask for clarification



If you have any questions about contributing, please open an issue or contact the maintainers.
